rougelikeLibrary

Class RoomCreator

  • java.lang.Object
    • rougelikeLibrary.RoomCreator

  • public class RoomCreator
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles logic for creating and populating new rooms. Every room contains x Characters, Items and doors.

      • createInitialRoom

        public Room createInitialRoom(Position position,
                              java.util.Map<Position.CardinalDirection,Position.CardinalDirectionPermission> doorCardinalDirectionPermissions)
        Creates the initial room. All cardinal directions for doors is optional with a minimum of one door.
        Parameters:
        position - coordinate in world space for the room

                       java.util.Map<Position.CardinalDirection,Position.CardinalDirectionPermission> cardinalDirectionPermissions)

        Creates a new room at the specified coordinate.
        Parameters:
        position - coordinate in world space for the room
        Returns:
        Room
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if min or max quantity of given type is not completed.

        Adds type to a position in room based on probability, minimum quantity and not exceeding maximum quantity
        Parameters:

      • addToRoom

        public void addToRoom(java.util.Map<Position,java.util.List<Mappable>> roomMap,
                      Position position,
                      Mappable mappableType)
        Adds a mappable type to a position in room map
        Parameters:
        roomMap - the map that contains all lists of mappables per position
        position - the position in map
        mappableType - the mappable type to add to the position

      • addDoors

        public void addDoors(Room room,
                     java.util.Map<Position.CardinalDirection,Position.CardinalDirectionPermission> cardinalDirectionPermissions)
        Adds a door in a specific cardinal direction based on cardinal direction permissions. The permissions dictate if it is mandatory, optional or disallowed. If it's optional it's probability based if the door is created.
        Parameters:
        room - the room to add doors to
        cardinalDirectionPermissions - the permissions that dictates optional (i.e. probability based), mandatory or disallowed.

      • getCardinalDirectionPC

        public boolean getCardinalDirectionPC(Position.CardinalDirectionPermission cardinalDirectionPermission)
        Calculates the choice based on the permissions. Optional is roughly 50% probability for either true/false.
        Parameters:
        cardinalDirectionPermission - the permissions to calculate from.
        Returns:
        true if permission is mandatory or if random returns true on optional permission. If a permission is missing or is null, false will be returned.

      • getProbabilityBoolean

        public boolean getProbabilityBoolean(int percentProbability)
                              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns a boolean value based on the probability given as argument to get a random number in the span.
        Parameters:
        percentProbability - the probability in percent. 0 < probability <= 100.
        Returns:
        a boolean value based on the probability
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if probability is not 0 < probability <= 100.

      • getRandomRoomPosition

        public Position getRandomRoomPosition()
        Get a random position in roomSpace
        Returns:
        random position

      • getPositionCardinalDirection

        public Position getPositionCardinalDirection(Room room,
                                             Position.CardinalDirection cardinalDirection)
                                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Gets the position in the room for a given cardinal direction
        Parameters:
        room - the room for which the position is related to
        cardinalDirection - the direction in room to get a position for
        Returns:
        the position in room that corresponds to the cardinal direction
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
